Regulation Name(s): Nucleic acid-based device for the amplification, detection and identification of microbial pathogens directly from whole blood specimens
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for T2Bacteria Panel, a qualitative nucleic acid amplification and T2 magnetic resonance-based test for rapid identification of five bacterial species directly from whole blood
Indications for Use Summary: Aid in diagnosis of bacteremia by direct detection of five bacterial species in K2EDTA whole blood from patients with suspected bacteremia; results used alongside other clinical and laboratory data, not as sole basis for diagnosis or patient management
